snippet.title: Little Romance (Casio Loopy, 1996) -- FEMICOM.org
snippet.description:
"Little Romance" (リトルロマンス) is comic book authoring software for the Japan-only game console called the Casio Loopy. The Loopy was a 32-bit cartridge-based system with a built-in sticker printer. In "Little Romance," players edit scenes and characters to create their own comic panels. The panels can then be printed directly from the console and adhered to paper to create custom comics in the style of shoujo manga (Japanese comics for girls).

You can find more information about this and other retro games, electronics, and software featuring feminine design elements at FEMICOM.org.
